Description of incident: The DOT's Office of the              Inspector General reported a special agent's laptop was stolen on              July 27 from a government-owned vehicle in Miami, FL, parked in a              restaurant parking lot. It contained names, addresses, SSNs, and dates              of birth for 80,670 persons issued commercial drivers licenses in              Miami-Dade County, 42,800 persons in FL with FAA pilot certificates              and 9,000 persons with FL driver's licenses.  UPDATE              (11/21/06):A suspect was arrested in the same parking              lot where the theft occurred, but the laptop has not been recovered.              Investigators found a theft ring operating in the vicinity of the              restaurant parking lot.
